ABSTRACT Vale, Daniella Lopez. Ferramentas m ultidimensionais para previs√£o de propriedades de petr√≥leos brasileiros em an√°lise √∫nica. Rio de Janeiro, 2018. Tese ( Doutorado em Qu√≠mica) - Instituto de Qu√≠mica, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, 2018.

Petroleum derivatives represe nt a large part of the national energy matrix and the value of this depends on its properties. This leads to the need to be able to determine or predict properties rather than determining them through traditional methods, which require large sample volumes and analysis time. Therefore, the goal of this work is to develop multiway calibration models for various physicochemical properties of petroleum using GC√ó GC-TOFMS.

The procedure was performed using crude oil samples with API gravity ranging from 15.2 to 49.4 provided by Cenpes/ Petrobras. These were solubilized in dichloromethane along with a mixture of internal standard and analyze d by GC√ó GC- TOFMS using polar x non-polar column set, with a DB -17 column as first dimension and a DB -5 column as second dimens ion. The chromatographic method was developed to obtain a good resolution, providing a comprehensive compositional information. Among the different multiway techniques commonly applied to chromatographic data are the PARAllel FACtor analysis (PARAFAC), PAR Allel FACtor analysis 2 (PARAFAC2) and N -way Partial Least Squares (N -PLS), which are being evaluated in this work. The processed chromatograms of the 102 processed petroleum samples were previously aligned, so that the relationships obtained are reliable, through the Correlation Optimized Warping (COW) algorithm. Of these, a set of 85 samples were selected for modeling API grade, 80 for TIAC and 88 for maximum and minimum flow point. From these, about 80% of representative samples were selected for the cal ibration set and 20% for the forecast set .

The validation of each model was performed by selecting 20% of the samples as the control sample. The models were also evaluated for their coefficient of determination, correlating the data of the sample with thos e obtained by the model. Data of decomposition was obtained through the model N -PLS, PARAFAC with decomposition superior to 94% of explanation between the components. The N -PLS obtained Root Mean Square Error Calibration (RMSEC): 0.81, RMSEP: 1.96, Bias: - 5.8 √ó 10 -3 and R2Cal: 0.9808 for ¬∞API determination; RMSEC: 0.02413, RMSEP:, Bias:

8.7√ó10-3 and R2Cal: 0.9436 for crystal appearance temperature (TIAC). However, the application of N -PLS to determine the pour p oint ( PP) yielded RMSEC: 0.123 and R2Cal: 0.9999 for minimum PP and RMSEC: 0.0994 and R2Cal: 0.9999 for maximum PP, but RMSEP: 18.70 and RMSEP: 26.37, respectively, and is therefore discarded. Results of PARAFAC and PARAFAC2 applied to MLR, PCR and PLS did not obtain satisfactory results . Therefore , this type of comprehensive multiway technique provides an automation of responses generated using a drop of crude oil samples without pretreatment or fractionation steps. This analytical breakthrough will lead to reduced spending on numerous traditional an alyzes, lower sample consumption and time, making the characterization environmentally cleaner.
